page.title: 08Warping Drain
page.content: It is no longer used for this purpose. It is a water reservoir owned by the Crowle Internal Drainage Board.When it is cleaned out the first 27m from the river entrance is fitted out with the original oak planks. The drain contains freshwater fish such as pike,tench,perch, and the birdlife consists of coots,mallards and waterhens.The plant life consists of buttercups,nettles,cowslips, dandelions,dockleaves and broadleaves. The pump house at the western end of the drain houses 2 large pumps and 1 smaller electric one.Each of the larger pumps pumps 1900 tonnes of water an hour.The smaller electric one pumps 2400 tonnes per hour.The pump house drains from three drains, which converge at the pumping house,coming from Keadby,Ealand,Crowle and Eastoft.
